example: Rather than leaving immediately, they waited for the storm to abate.
Because we were running out of time, the lecturer had to abbreviate her speech.

korean: (왕위, 권한, 의무, 요구 등을) 포기하다, 버리다
example: When Edward VIII abdicated the British throne to marry the woman he loved, he surprised the entire world.
The movie Ransom describes the attempts to rescue a multimillionaire's son after the child's abduction by kidnappers.

korean: 엉뚱한, (행동 등이) 정도를 벗어난, (생물 돌연변이) 비정상적인
example: Given the aberrant nature of the data, we doubted the validity of the entire experiment.

definition: aid, usually in doing something wrong; encourage
example: She was unwilling to abet him in the swindle he had planned.
She abhorred all forms of bigotry.
On the streets of New York the homeless live in abject poverty ,huddling in doorways to find a shelter from the wind.
The president of the college refused to abolish the physical education requirement.
Mary liked John until she learned he was dating Susan; then she called him an abominable young man, with abominable taste in women.

definition: being the first of its kind in a region; primitive; native
example: Her studies of the primitive art forms of the aboriginal Indians were widely reported in the scientific journals.
Attacked by armed troops, the Chinese students had to abandon their abortive attempt to democratize Beijing peacefully.

definition: wear away by friction; scrape; erode
korean: ...을 마멸시키다, (피부 등을) 스쳐 벗기다, (바위 등을) 침식시키다
example: Because the sharp rocks had abraded the skin on her legs, she dabbed iodine on the scrapes and abrasions.

definition: rubbing away; tending to grind down
korean:
1. 벗겨지는, 쓸리는, 연마의
2. (목소리 등이) 신경질 나게 하는
example: Just as abrasive cleaning powders can wear away a shiny finish, abrasive remarks can wear away a listener's patience.
Because the publishers felt the public wanted a shorter version of War and Peace, they proceeded to abridge the novel.
The teller who absconded with the bonds went uncaptured until someone recognized him from his photograph on "America's Most Wanted."
Although the King of Siam was an absolute monarch, he did not want to behead his unfaithful wife without absolute evidence of her infidelity.
The father confessor absolved him of his sins.

During the nineteenth century, America absorbed hordes of immigrants, turning them into productive citizens. Can Huggies diapers absorb more liquid than Pampers can? This question does not absorb me; instead, it bores me.

definition: refrain; hold oneself back voluntarily from an action or practice
example: After considering the effect of alcohol on his athletic performance, he decided to abstain from drinking while he trained for the race.

definition: sparing in eating and drinking; temperate
example: Concerned whether her vegetarian son's abstemious diet provided him with sufficient protein, the worried mother pressed food on him.
The doctor recommended total abstinence from salted foods.
To him, hunger was an abstract concept; he had never missed a meal.
Baffled by the abstruse philosophical texts assigned in class, Dave asked Lexy to explain Kant's Critique of Pure Reason.
At his immigration interview, Ivan listed his abundant reasons for coming to America: the hope of religious freedom, the prospect of employment, the promise of a more abundant life.
An abusive parent damages a child both mentally and physically.
His arrogance is exceeded only by his abysmal ignorance.
Darth Vader seized the evil emperor and hurled him down into the abyss.

definition:
1. related to education
2. not practical or directly useful
example: When Sharon applied for the faculty post, the dean asked about her academic qualifications. Seismologists' studies about earthquakes are not of purely academic interest, for these studies enable us to assess the danger of potential earthquakes.
If I accede to this demand for blackmail, I am afraid that I will be the victim of future demands.
In our science class, we learn how falling bodies accelerate.

korean: 강조[역설]하다, <색체.음성 등을> 강하게 하다, 두드러지게 하다
example: If you can accentuate the positive and eliminate the negative, you may wind up with an overoptimistic view of the world.

korean: 접근[면회]하기 쉬운, 호감이 가는, 잉용하기 쉬운
example: We asked our guide whether the ruins were accessible on foot.

definition: additional object; useful but not essential thing
example: She bought an attractive handbag as an accessory for her dress.
The NBC sportscasters acclaimed every American victory in the Olympics and decried every American defeat.

definition: adjust to new climate or conditions
example: the goal of the freshman orientation program is to enable new students to acclimate to life on campus.
In Hollywood, an "Oscar" is the highest accolade.

definition: provision of housing; settlement or compromise
example: We used the cottage for the accommodation of visiting relatives. In 1949-1950, a chance existed for the Chinese Communist Party and the United States to reach an accommodation or, at least, to avoid a confrontation.
Because he had provided the criminal with a lethal weapon, he was arrested as an accomplice in the murder.
She was in complete accord with the verdict.

korean:
신[쓴, 떫은] 맛
(성질, 표현의) 과격, 매서움, 신랄함
example: The meeting of the United Nations General Assembly was marked with such acerbity that informed sources held out little hope of reaching any useful settlement of the problem.
Although Iris acknowledged that the Beatles' tunes sounded pretty dated nowadays, she still preferred them to the hip-hog songs her brothers played.
His success in this role marked the acme of his career as an actor

definition: science of sound; quality that makes a room easy or hard to hear in
example: Carnegie Hall is liked by music lovers because of its fine acoustics.
Although she appeared to acquiesce to her employer's suggestions, I could tell she had reservations about the changes he wanted made.
Frederick Douglass was determined to acquire an education despite his master's efforts to prevent him doing so.
His acquittal by the jury surprised those who had thought him guilty.
The acrid odor of burnt gunpowder filled the room after the pistol had been fired.

korean: (태도, 말투가) 톡 쏘는, 독살스런, 신랄한, 격론
example: The candidate attacked his opponent in highly acrimonious terms.
In time his youthful acuity of vision failed him, and he needed glasses.
His business acumen helped him to succeed where others had failed.

definition:
1. quickly perceptive
2. keen
3. brief and severe
example: The acute young doctor realized immediately that the gradual deterioration of her patient's once acute hearing was due to a chronic illness, not an acute one.
There is much truth in the old adage about fools and their money.
Bronson played the part of a revenge-driven man, adamant in his determination to punish the criminals who destroyed his family.
Some species of animals have become extinct because they could not adapt to a changing environment.
His addiction to drugs caused his friends much grief.
This idiotic plan is confusing enough to addle anyone.

definition: direct a speech to; deal with or discuss
example: Due to address the convention in July, Brown planned to address the issue of low-income housing in his speech.
She was adept at the fine art of irritating people.
I will adhere to this opinion until proof that I am wrong is presented.
In the wake of the scandal, the senator's one-time adherents quickly deserted him.
Philip's best friend Jason lived only four houses down the block, close but not immediately adjacent.

definition: something added on or attached (generally nonessential or inferior)
example: Although I don't absolutely need a second computer, I plan to buy a laptop to serve as an adjunct to my desktop model.

After the student protesters repeatedly rejected the dean's admonitions, the administration issued an ultimatum: either the students would end the demonstration at once or the campus police would arrest the demonstrators.

definition:
1. legally take a child as one's own
2. choose to follow
3. assume an attitude
4. formally accept (a suggestion or report)
example: Tom and Joan adopted a daughter. I just adopted a new weight-loss plan. Don't adopt such a patronizing tone when you talk to me! Was the committee's report adopted unanimously, or did anyone abstain.
Wall paintings and carved statues adorned the temple.
His adroit handling of the delicate situation pleased his employers.

definition: make impure by adding inferior or tainted substances
example: It is a crime to adulterate foods without informing the buyer; when consumers learned that Beech-Nut had adulterated their apple juice by mixing it with water, they protested vigorously.

definition: arrival of someone or something notable.
example: The advent of driverless cars is bound to revolutionize the automotive industry.
The young wrestler struggled to defeat is adversary.
The recession had a highly adverse effect on Father's investment portfolio: he lost so much money that he had to sell our summer cottage.

definition: unfavorable fortune; hardship; a calamitous event
example: According to the humorist Mark Twain, anyone can easily learn to endure adversity, as long as it is another man's.

definition: support; active pleading on something's behalf
example: No threats could dissuade Bishop Desmond Tutu from his advocacy of the human rights of Black South Africans.
The abolitionists advocated freedom for the slaves.

definition: artistic; dealing with or capable of appreciation of the beautiful
example: The beauty of Tiffany's stained glass appealed to Esther's aesthetic sense.
Accustomed to cold, aloof supervisors, Nicholas was amazed at how affable his new employer was.

definition: artificial; pretended; assumed in order to impress
example: His affected mannerisms - his "Harvard" accent, air of boredom, use of obscure foreign words - annoyed us: he acted as if he thought he was too good for his old high school friends.

korean: 인척 관계, 좋아함, 밀접한 관계, 친화성
example: She felt an affinity with all who suffered; their pains were her pains.

definition: positive assertion; confirmation; solemn pledge by one who refuses to take an oath.
example: Despite Tom's affirmations of innocence, Aunt Polly still suspected he had eaten the pie.

definition: state of distress; cause of suffering.
example: Even in the midst of her affliction, Elizabeth tried to keep up the spirits of those around her.
Foreigners are amazed by the affluence and luxury of the American way of life.

definition:
1. have enough money to pay for
2. provide
example: Although Phil is not sure he can afford a membership at the yoga studio, he wants to sign up because of the excellent training the studio affords.
People around the world wondered what the aftermath of China's violent suppression of the student protests would be.

definition: items of business at a meeting
example: We had so much difficulty agreeing upon an agenda that there was very little time for the meeting.

definition: means or instrument; personal representative; person acting in an official capacity
example: "I will be the agent of America's destruction," proclaimed the beady-eyed villian, whose agent had gottem him the role. With his face, he could never have played the part of the hero, a heroic F.B.I. agent.
The history of the past quarter centruy illustrates how a President may aggrandize his power to act aggressively in international affairs without considering the wishes of Congress.
Before the Wall Street scandals, dealers in so-called junk bonds managed to aggregate great wealth in short periods of time.
Before you punish both boys for fighting, see whether you can determine which one was the aggressor.
The agility of the acrobat amazed and thrilled the audience.
Her fiery remarks agitated the already angry mob.

definition: one who is skeptical of the existnee or knowability of a god or any ultimate reality.
example: Agnostics say we can neither prove nor disprove the existence of God; we simply just can't know.
Eager to get away to the mountains, Phil and Dave packed up their ski gear and climbed into the van with alacrity.
John Smith's alias was Bob Jones.
Her attempts to alienate the two friends failed because they had to complete faith in each other.
The alimentary canal in our bodies is so named because digestion of foods occurs there. When asked for the name of digestive tract, Sherlock Holmes replied, "Alimentary, my dear Watson."

definition: payments made to an ex-spouse after divorce
example: Because Tony had supported Tina through medical school, on their divorce he asked the court to award him $500 a month in alimony.
The crew tried to allay the fears of the passengers by announcing that the fire had been controlled.
Although it is alleged that she has worked for the enemy, she denies the allegation and, legally, we can take no action against her without proof.
Not even a term in prison could shake Lech Walesa's allegiance to Solidarity, the Polish trade union he had helped to found.

definition: story in which characters are used as symbols; fable
example: Pilgrim's Progress is an allegory of the temptations and victories of man's soul.
This should alleviate the pain; if it does not, we shall have to use stringer drugs.

definition: repetition of beginning sound in poetry.
example: "The furrow follwed free" is an example of alliteration.
Even though the Red Cross had allocated a large sum for the relief of the sufferers of the disaster, many people perished.
Try not to mention divorce in Jack's presence because he will think you are alluding to his marital problems with Jill.
Allured by the song of the sirens, the helmsman steered the ship toward the reef.
Amanda's retort to the ticket scalper - "Five hundred bucks? What do you want, a pound of flesh?" - was an allusion to the plot of Shakespeare's Merchant of Venice.
The sailor climbed aloft into the rigging. To get into a loft bed, you have to climb aloft.
Shy by nature, she remained aloof while all the rest conversed.
In that hot-tempered household, no meal ever came to a peaceful conclusion; the inevitable altercation might even end in blows.
In providing tutorial assistance and college scholarships for hundreds of economically disadvantaged youths, Eugene Lang performed a truly altruistic deed.
The unions will attempt to amalgamate their groups into one national body.
The miser's aim is to amass and hoard as much gold as possible.

definition: capable of using either hand with equal ease.
example: A switch-hitter in baseball should be naturally ambidextrous
She went to the restaurant not for the food but for the ambience.
His ambiguous instructions misled us; we did not know which road to take.

definition: the state of having contradictory or conflicting emotional attitudes
example: Torn between loving her parents one minute and hating them the next, she was upset by the ambivalence of her feelings.
Juan was a highly ambulatory patient; not only did he refuse to be confined to bed, but he insisted on riding his skateboaard up and down the halls.
Many social workers have attempted to ameliorate the conditions of people living in the slums.

definition: readily managed; willing to be led
example: Although the ambassador was usually amenable to friendly suggestions, he balked when we hinted that he should waive his diplomatic immunity and pay his parking tickets.

definition: correct; change, generally for the better
example: Hoping to amend his condition, he left Vietnam for the United States.
In Little Woman, Beth is the amiable daughter whose loving disposition endears her to all who know her.

Beth's sister Jo is the hot-tempered tomboy who has a hard time maintaining amicable relations with those around her. Jo's quarrel with her friend Laurie finally reaches an amicable settlement, but not because Jo turns amiable overnight.
Student exchange programs such as the Experiment in International Living were established to promote international amity.
Because she was suggering from smnesia, the police could not get the young girl to identify herself.
When his first child was born, the king granted amnesty to all in prison.
The amoral individual lacks a code of ethics; he cannot tell right from wrong. The immoral person can tell right from wrong; he chooses to do something he knows is wrong.
"Love them and leave them" was the motto of the amorous Don Juan.
As soon as we have decided on our itinerary, we shall send you a copy; right now, our plans are still amorphous.

definition: able to live both on land and in water
example: Frogs are classified as amphibian.
Bond had ample opportunity to escape. Why did he let us catch him?

definition: increase in volumne or intensity; add details to clarify or broaden (a story or report)
example: Lucy used a loudspeaker to amplify her voice, drowning out poor Charlie Brown's attempt to amplify his earlier remarks.

definition: cut off part of body; prune
example: Though the doctors had to amputate his leg to prevent the spread of cancer, the young athlete refused to let the loss of a limb keep him from participating in sports.

definition: having an error involving time in a story
example: The reference to clocks in Julius Caesar is anachronistic: clocks did not exist in Caesar's time.
She called our attention to the things that had been done in an analogous situation and recommended that we do the same.
A well-known analogy compares the body's immune system with an army whose defending troops are the lymphocytes or white blood cells.

definition: person who seeks to overturn the established government; advocate of abolishing authority
example: Denying she was an anarchist, Katya maintained she wished only to make changes in our government, not to destroy it entirely.
David can trace his ancestry as far back as the seventeenth century, when one of his ancestors was a court trumpeter somewhere in Germany.

definition: secure or fasten firmly; be fixed in place
example: We set the post in concrete to anchor it in place.

definition: short account of an amusing or interesting event
example: At the wedding rehearsal dinner, the best man embarrassed the groom by telling anecdotes about their undergraduate escapades.

definition: condition in which blood lacks red corpuscles
example: The doctor ascribes her tiredness to anemia.

definition: substance that removes sensation with or without loss of consciousness
example: His monotonous voice acted like an anesthetic; his audience was soon asleep.
Visiting the site of the explosion, the governor wept to see the anguish of the victims and their families.
Mr. Spock's features, though angular, were curiously attractive, in a Vulcan way.

definition:
1. lively
2. made to appear to move as if alive
korean: 생기 있는, 활발한; 살아 있는 듯한
example: When John has a topic that truly interests him, he can be an animated and engaging conversationalist. Just listen to him on the subject of Japanese animated films.
He incurred the animosity of the ruling class because he advocated limitations of their power.
Mexico objected to the United States' attempts to annex the territory that later became the state of Texas.
The enemy in its revenge tried to annihilate the entire population.
In explanatory notes following each poem, the editor carefully annotated the poet's more esoteric references.
The parents of the eloped couple tried to annul the marriage.
He was placed in the anomalous position of seeming to approve procedures that he despised.
